this-action.description: Indicates where the form should submit to. Value must be a URL

this-app-container.description: This indicates the container to hold the app. If no element with such attribute is found, the body tag is assumed.

description: Works with `this-reload`. Indicates that when clicked, the target of `this-reload` should be reloaded with the value of `this-attributes` as the target's attributes
The value should contain attributes to pass onto the target in the format ATTR:VALUE. Multiple ATTR:VALUE pairs should be separated by a semi-colon (;), just like the `style` attribute.

this-autocomplete.description: Indicates that the input field should be autocompleted from the given url

description: Binds an element and its children to a model. The value is the ID of the model
All variables in the element would be parsed based on the binded model
This is only required if the element is on the same page as the link that connects it to a model. If they are on different pages, `this-model` alone would suffice.

this-binding.description: Indicates that an element is bound to a model

this-block-code.description: Indicates the content is code and should be wrapped in `<pre><code>`

this-code.description: Indicates that the content should be parsed as code by replacing < with &lt; and > with &gt;

description: Indicates a placeholder for a component. The value is the ID of the component to load
If the component needs to be loaded from file, leave value has empty and add attribute `this-url` instead.

this-content.description: Indicates the area to load the content into in a layout

description: May be used together with `this-goto` or `this-bind`. It must also have a `this-model` attribute.
It indicates that the target page/container is or contains a form which would create a model. This is the C in CRUD.
The value can be the resource url or empty. If empty, the url would be generated autogenerated from the collection url

this-data.description: This attaches the given property name to the collection, which is in a model

this-dead.description: Indicates a page which is being navigated away from

description: Indicates the page as the default page to load if no page is specified. As such, only one page should be tagged as default.
Having multiple pages with the attribute throws an error and no page is loaded

this-delay.description: This is the amount of time to wait after the user stops typing before trying to autocompleting entry. This is in milliseconds

description: If the element also has attribute `this-goto`, it would load the target page. If the element does not have attribute `this-goto`, the deletion is effected
It must also have a `this-model` attribute.
This is the D in CRUD.
The value can be the resource url or empty. If empty, the url would be generated autogenerated from the collection url
If applied on pages, it indicates the CRUD action that the page is expected to perform. This shouldn't be done manually as it is generated based on the link clicked
If applied on form and value is `search`, the form becomes a search form and expects an input field with attribute `this-search`
Indicates that the value is to be looped over. The value could be an attribute of a model/value, if the value is iteratable, a parsed variable, or a direct array.
To iterate over an iterable value of a model/value, just supply the attribute name to the value WITHOUT PARENTHESIS
To iterate over a parsed variable, put the variable in-between double curly brackets e.g. {{variable}}. The variable may very well be filtered as with normal variables
To iterate over a direct array, surround the array with ({ and })
Each loop item may be filtered with `this-filter`
Within each loop, variables `key` and `value` are available.
Finalizes branching. Requires no value and if provided, it is ignored.
Element will only remain if `this-if` and `this-else-if` expressions fail otherwise, it is removed.
Continues branching. Expression will only be executed if the `this-if` and previous `this-else-if` expressions fail
If expression passes, the element stays in the DOM otherwise, it is removed.
If this ends the branching, that is, no `this-else` is given, add attribute `this-end-if`
Note: The expression should not be surrounded by ({...}). This is known to cause issues.
Indicates the end of a branching. It is only required on `this-if` or the last `this-end-if`
If the brancing includes a `this-else` element, there's not need for `this-end-if` then.

this-extends.description: The name of the target layout the layout is extending

description: The expression filters the items to display. The expression is provided with variable `current` which holds the current item in the iteration
If iterating a collection, `current` has attributes `index` and `model`
If iterating a loop, `current` has attributes `key` and `value`
If the expression fails, the value is skipped.
A function may be called in the expression. The function must however return `TRUE` or `FALSE` which indicates that the model/value should be operated on or skipped respectively
Example: functionName(current)
This is the id of the form to target
Combined with `this-create`, clicking the element prepares and opens the given form for model creation.
The form must exist in the current page and would be loaded in the same page.

this-go-back.description: Navigates the app back in history

this-go-forward.description: Navigates the app forward in history

this-go-home.description: Navigates the app to the home page

description: Holds the id of, name of, or path to, the page to load when the element is clicked.

this-hidden.description: Makes the element hidden by default

description: When clicked, hides the target element. The value is the ID of the element.
Multiple elements can also be targeted by separating their IDs with comma

this-id.description: The ID of the element type

description: Starts branching. The value should be the logical expression to check
This can be used with `this-else-if` and/or `this-else`. If neither is required, this must also have `this-end-if`
If the expression passes, then the element stays and `this-else-if` and `this-else` elements are removed.
Note: The expression should not be surrounded by ({...}). This is known to cause issues.

this-ignore.description: Used to temporarily ignore children branching when processing parent branching

description: Used with `this-goto`, it indicates that the target should not be loaded from cache but from the server
The value would be in the format TYPE#ID e.g. collection#users

this-ignore-submit.description: Indicates that the form should not be processed when submitted

this-in-collection.description: Indicates that a model element is within a collection element

this-inline-code.description: Indicates the content is code and should be wrapped in `<code>`

description: Bind a property of the model to the form element. The value should be the property of the model.
If the value of the property is an object or array, children value can be targeted by connecting the propertys with dots (.).
For example, say there's an object `{name:{first:"John", last:"Doe"},hobbies:["Reading","Playing the guitar"]}`, `this-is` values could be `name.first`, `name.last`, `hobbies.0`, `hobbies.1`
The form must be bound to a model with attribute `this-model`.
This holds the unique key that identifies each suggested item when autcompleting. This is usually the uid of the model applied to the suggestion item from the array list gotten from the server

this-layout.description: The layout a page should use. If none is specified, the general app layout is used if specified. And if that isn't specified either, the page is loaded without a layout.

this-list.description: This is the id of target list element to hold the list of found suggestions

description: Loads the given css file into the page.
To load multiple files, provide a comma-separated list of file names.
Loads the given js file after the page has been loaded
To load multiple files, provide a comma-separated list of file names.
Loads the given js file before the page is loaded
To load multiple files, provide a comma-separated list of file names.

this-loaded.on: layouts, pages, components, collections, models, links, scripts

this-mid.description: The unique id of a particular model.

this-min-chars.description: This is the minimum number of characters the user must have entered before trying to autocomplete entry

description: The name of the model to bind an element to. This is necessary to clearly differentiate entity types from one another.
On a collection, if the attribute is not provided, the `this-id` value is assumed.
The name of the model key which serves as the unique identifier. Every element with `this-model` should have one.
If none is specified, `id` is assumed

this-multiple.description: This indicates that multiple suggestions can be selected instead of the default one

description: This indicates the container's content should not be loaded with the specified model
The value is the id of the model
In case where there are descendant models, the value may be a comma-separated list of model ids
Used on links with `this-goto`, it holds the title for the target page
If the page already has a `this-title` attribute, it is overriden
Indicates that the collection should be paginated
Value is the number of results to show per page.
If no value is provided, the config limit apply.
Indicates that the element to show the next page on the target collection.
Value is the id of the target collection.
If no value is provided, the sibling collection is targeted.
Indicates that the element to show the previous page on the target collection.
Value is the id of the target collection.
If no value is provided, the sibling collection is targeted.
Indicates that new page results should overwrite existing collection content
The relative path to the page file based on the config pages base path

this-prepend.description: Indicates that each element in the collection/loop should be prepended to the container

this-prepend-new.description: Indicates that new models should be prepended to the collection listing instead of appended, which is the default

this-query.description: Holds the string being searched for when a search is performed

this-query-key.description: This is the GET parameter key on which to send the user entry when autocompleting. Defaults to `q` if not provided.

description: Used together with `this-goto` and within a model, it indicates that the page being link would read the model within which is the current element. This is the R in CRUD.
The value then can be empty.
However, if another model is to be read and not the one within which the link is, then the value is the url of the model and the model name must be also provided with the attribute `this-model`.

this-reading.description: Indicates that the page is reading from a model

description: Used on selection lists for autocomplete input elements and indicates that the expression value should be used as default data when loading form elements from a model.
Object `model` is available to the expression and holds the model from which the form is being loaded.
For this to happen, the autocomplete input element must have a `this-is` attribute whose value holds the key which holds a list of already selected ids.
Used on selection lists for autocomplete input elements and holds the url from which the data to load as default when loading form elements from a model.
A post request is sent to the provided link with a data object having a single key `ids` which is an array of ids found in the default value for the input element.
For this to happen, the autocomplete input element must have a `this-is` attribute whose value holds the key which holds a list of already selected ids.
When clicked, the target should be reloaded. To be reloaded, `this-attributes` must be applied.
If no value is specified, the page, layouts and all resources are reloaded

this-reload-layouts.description: Reloads the page and loaded layouts

description: Used on any element within a form and indicates that the element should be reset when other form elements are being reset.
Value can be a semi-colon separated string of attribute:value to be set when resetting the form.
For example, on an image, the value may be 'src:/path/to/default/image.jpg;class:default
If value is empty, it is treated like other forms and the `value` attribute is set to empty
Input element must have `this-do` with value of 'search'
The value is a string in the format COLLECTION_ID:comma,separated,keys,to,search

this-selection-list.description: Holds the id of the list element that would hold selected suggestions

description: Shows the target element. The value is the ID of the element.
Multiple elements can also be targeted by separating their IDs with comma
This indicates that the collection should only be loaded once on the page.
To ensure staticity, make the collection a component.

this-tar.description: Temporary attribute which holds other attributes. This is given to a template element. When the template is parsed, the attribute value is parsed and passed on to the parsed element after which it is removed

this-title.description: Holds the title of the page

this-toggle.description: Toggles the display of the target element on/off. The value is the ID of the element.

this-type.description: Indicates the type of container an element is
this-type.on: pages, models, collections, components, layouts, lists

description: Used together with `this-goto` and within a model, it indicates that the page is, or contains, a form which would update the model within which is the current element. This is the U in CRUD.
The value can be the resource url or empty. If empty, the url would be generated autogenerated from the collection url

this-uid.description: The name of the model key which serves as the unique identifier. This is only found on model elements

this-url.description: The url to the resource to load into the element or to send the form data to

this-with-css.description: Indicates that the elem has custom css files loaded with it

this-with-first-js.description: Indicates that the elem has custom js files loaded with it before the page was loaded

this-with-js.description: Indicates that the elem has custom js files loaded with it after the page was loaded
